title: Nuclear-Powered Submarines for Australia? Maybe Not So Fast.
content: Australia’s plan to build the submarines with U.S. and British help faces big hurdles. Supporters say they can be overcome. Critics say they may be too much.
en_title: Nuclear-Powered Submarines for Australia? Maybe Not So Fast.
en_content: Australia’s plan to build the submarines with U.S. and British help faces big hurdles. Supporters say they can be overcome. Critics say they may be too much.

title: Why China Is the World’s Last ‘Zero Covid’ Holdout
content: The government has staked its political legitimacy on controlling the virus better than other countries, especially its geopolitical rivals.
en_title: Why China Is the World’s Last ‘Zero Covid’ Holdout
en_content: The government has staked its political legitimacy on controlling the virus better than other countries, especially its geopolitical rivals.

title: Meeting of Francis and Biden Will Highlight Rift With U.S. Bishops
content: The pope and president, who will meet at the Vatican on Friday, are common targets of conservative American bishops seeking to undercut them.
en_title: Meeting of Francis and Biden Will Highlight Rift With U.S. Bishops
en_content: The pope and president, who will meet at the Vatican on Friday, are common targets of conservative American bishops seeking to undercut them.

title: After Time of ‘Real Terror,’ City’s Resilience Is Symbolized in Statue
content: Brescia, Italy, was one of the first Western cities devastated by the pandemic. It has adopted a famed ancient statue, “Winged Victory,” as the emblem of its recovery — and a prod for visits.
en_title: After Time of ‘Real Terror,’ City’s Resilience Is Symbolized in Statue
en_content: Brescia, Italy, was one of the first Western cities devastated by the pandemic. It has adopted a famed ancient statue, “Winged Victory,” as the emblem of its recovery — and a prod for visits.

title: In Japan, Rural Voters Count More Than Those in Big Cities. It Shows.
content: The disproportionate weight of rural voters in Japan gives sparsely populated parts of the country more representation — and more government largess — than urban areas, perpetuating what critics call an unfair system.

more_info.byline: By Motoko Rich, Makiko Inoue and Hikari Hida

en_title: In Japan, Rural Voters Count More Than Those in Big Cities. It Shows.
en_content: The disproportionate weight of rural voters in Japan gives sparsely populated parts of the country more representation — and more government largess — than urban areas, perpetuating what critics call an unfair system.

title: France Detains British Boat as a Fight Over Fishing Rights Escalates
content: The British government summoned France’s ambassador for talks over the incident, the latest sign of cross-Channel tension between the two countries.
en_title: France Detains British Boat as a Fight Over Fishing Rights Escalates
en_content: The British government summoned France’s ambassador for talks over the incident, the latest sign of cross-Channel tension between the two countries.

title: China Says It Won’t Build New Coal Plants Abroad. What Does That Mean?
content: Beijing is the undisputed king of coal, but the announcement at the United Nations General Assembly this week was cautiously welcomed by climate experts.
en_title: China Says It Won’t Build New Coal Plants Abroad. What Does That Mean?
en_content: Beijing is the undisputed king of coal, but the announcement at the United Nations General Assembly this week was cautiously welcomed by climate experts.

title: Saudi Finance Official Is Missing From Conference He Hosts
content: The unexplained absence of Yasir al-Rumayyan, who oversees the kingdom’s sovereign wealth fund, has highlighted concerns about a lack of transparency.
en_title: Saudi Finance Official Is Missing From Conference He Hosts
en_content: The unexplained absence of Yasir al-Rumayyan, who oversees the kingdom’s sovereign wealth fund, has highlighted concerns about a lack of transparency.

title: Wes Anderson’s Dream of France, and the Paris I Remember
content: With “The French Dispatch,” the director’s latest, yet another American artist falls under the country’s spell. The Times’s Paris bureau chief recalls when the same thing happened to him.

en_content: With “The French Dispatch,” the director’s latest, yet another American artist falls under the country’s spell. The Times’s Paris bureau chief recalls when the same thing happened to him.

title: Coronavirus cases and deaths were vastly underestimated in U.S. meatpacking plants, a House report says.
content: The industry had three times as many Covid infections in the pandemic’s early months as previously believed, a select committee says.
en_title: Coronavirus cases and deaths were vastly underestimated in U.S. meatpacking plants, a House report says.
en_content: The industry had three times as many Covid infections in the pandemic’s early months as previously believed, a select committee says.

title: France and the United States Seek an Elusive Reconciliation
content: The Biden administration is poised to offer the French some defense-related emollients after their falling out over a sabotaged submarine deal. But some damage may last.

more_info.byline: By Roger Cohen and Helene Cooper
des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces

en_title: France and the United States Seek an Elusive Reconciliation
en_content: The Biden administration is poised to offer the French some defense-related emollients after their falling out over a sabotaged submarine deal. But some damage may last.

title: Oakland educators approve a plan to transfer or unenroll students who are not vaccinated by January.
content: Students who do not comply with the school district’s vaccine mandate will have two choices: switch to an independent-study school or be dropped from the rolls.

more_info.byline: By Azi Paybarah and Jenny Gross

en_title: Oakland educators approve a plan to transfer or unenroll students who are not vaccinated by January.
en_content: Students who do not comply with the school district’s vaccine mandate will have two choices: switch to an independent-study school or be dropped from the rolls.

title: Syringe shortages could be yet another obstacle in Africa’s Covid vaccination efforts, the W.H.O. warns.
content: The continent already suffers from high infection levels, low vaccination rates and limited, unpredictable deliveries of vaccine doses.
en_title: Syringe shortages could be yet another obstacle in Africa’s Covid vaccination efforts, the W.H.O. warns.
en_content: The continent already suffers from high infection levels, low vaccination rates and limited, unpredictable deliveries of vaccine doses.

title: Childhood vaccinations have lagged across the world because of the pandemic.
content: Millions of young children did not get immunized against polio, measles and other diseases.

org_facet: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

en_title: Childhood vaccinations have lagged across the world because of the pandemic.
en_content: Millions of young children did not get immunized against polio, measles and other diseases.

title: New Zealand will cut the amount of quarantine time for travelers in half.
en_title: New Zealand will cut the amount of quarantine time for travelers in half.

title: China plans to let vaccinated athletes skip quarantine at the Winter Olympics.
content: Competitors will still face strict rules at what is shaping up to be the most extraordinarily regulated, large-scale sporting event since the pandemic’s start and could be expelled for breaking them.

more_info.byline: By Vivian Wang and Motoko Rich

en_title: China plans to let vaccinated athletes skip quarantine at the Winter Olympics.
en_content: Competitors will still face strict rules at what is shaping up to be the most extraordinarily regulated, large-scale sporting event since the pandemic’s start and could be expelled for breaking them.

title: Daily coronavirus cases in Japan fall to the hundreds after a summer peak.

title: Iran Will Rejoin Nuclear Talks, Top Negotiator Says
content: Negotiations on reviving the 2015 nuclear accord are to resume in November, but it is unclear if the United States will take part in them.

title: What Happened When a Hellishly Hot Tiny Town Offered ‘Free’ Land
content: The town in Australia’s outback, where the temperature can hit 113 degrees Fahrenheit, drew hundreds of global inquiries when it put out the call in a bid to expand its population.
en_title: What Happened When a Hellishly Hot Tiny Town Offered ‘Free’ Land
en_content: The town in Australia’s outback, where the temperature can hit 113 degrees Fahrenheit, drew hundreds of global inquiries when it put out the call in a bid to expand its population.

title: Viktor Bryukhanov, Blamed for the Chernobyl Disaster, Dies at 85
content: In charge of the plant in Ukraine, he was held responsible for the world’s worst nuclear-power disaster and imprisoned.
en_title: Viktor Bryukhanov, Blamed for the Chernobyl Disaster, Dies at 85
en_content: In charge of the plant in Ukraine, he was held responsible for the world’s worst nuclear-power disaster and imprisoned.

title: Israel Advances Plan for New Settlement Homes, in First for Bennett Era
content: Approved despite the objections of the United States, critics say the new building will consolidate Israel’s presence in the West Bank and make it harder to create a Palestinian state.
en_title: Israel Advances Plan for New Settlement Homes, in First for Bennett Era
en_content: Approved despite the objections of the United States, critics say the new building will consolidate Israel’s presence in the West Bank and make it harder to create a Palestinian state.

title: B.J. Novak’s Face Is on Products Worldwide. He’s Not Sure Why.
content: An image of the actor appears on an eclectic mix of products from China to Uruguay. “I am too amused to do anything about it,” he said on Instagram.
en_title: B.J. Novak’s Face Is on Products Worldwide. He’s Not Sure Why.

title: Pope Expresses ‘Willingness’ to Visit Canada for Indigenous Reconciliation
content: A National Truth and Reconciliation Commission has called for a papal apology for abuses at church-run schools for Indigenous children.

title: Wonders, and Horrors, Drawn From Boyhood in a War Zone

title: Unequal vaccine access is widening the global economic gap, a U.N. agency says.
content: Wealthier countries with high vaccination rates have had speedier economic recoveries than poorer countries with low vaccination rates, the International Labor Organization said.
en_title: Unequal vaccine access is widening the global economic gap, a U.N. agency says.
en_content: Wealthier countries with high vaccination rates have had speedier economic recoveries than poorer countries with low vaccination rates, the International Labor Organization said.

title: China’s Weapon Tests Close to a ‘Sputnik Moment,’ U.S. General Says

title: Taliban Allow Girls to Return to Some High Schools, but With Big Caveats
content: In some provinces, teenage girls have been allowed to return to secondary schools, though some teachers and parents still have doubts about what this means about Taliban rule.

more_info.byline: By Christina Goldbaum and Kiana Hayeri

en_title: Taliban Allow Girls to Return to Some High Schools, but With Big Caveats
en_content: In some provinces, teenage girls have been allowed to return to secondary schools, though some teachers and parents still have doubts about what this means about Taliban rule.
